alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, northwestern Nicholas, south central Gilmer, western Braxton, southeastern Roane, west central Webster and Clay Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clay, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sutton, Clay, Gassaway, Birch River, Big Otter, Wallback, Harrison, Widen, Nebo, Frametown, Strange Creek, Wilsie, Bickmore, Procious, Servia, Rosedale, Muddlety, Boggs, Little Birch, and Ivydale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 31 and 64. Route 19 between mile markers 47 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Roane
